title: Video appears to show NBA star Ja Morant filming himself with toy gun after second weapons-related incident
description: Last month, a video appeared to show Ja Morant holding a gun. A video that surfaced Saturday shows Morant holding what appeared to be a toy gun days after the social media video.

title: Michael Cohen, Trump’s former lawyer and witness against him, denied release from probation
description: A judge denied Michael Cohen early release from his probation Friday, citing recent false statements he said Cohen made in a book and on TV.

title: Ray Lewis III, son of Hall of Famer Ray Lewis, died of a suspected overdose: police report
description: Officers found former Miami football player Ray Lewis III unconscious in a bedroom at a Florida home Wednesday, according to the Casselberry Police Department.

title: Donald Triplett, a savant who was the first person diagnosed with autism, dies at 89
description: Donald Triplett, who became the first person diagnosed with autism, died on Thursday at the age of 89. A Mississippi native, he worked at Bank of Forest for 65 years.

title: Kate Middleton honors Princess Diana at King Charles’ Trooping the Colour
description: Princess of Wales, Kate Middleton, honored Princess Diana during King Charles's Trooping of Colour event by wearing diamond earrings she previously owned.

title: WATCH: Shop clerk traps would-be thief under store shutter until police arrive
description: The would-be thief tried to escape before the shutter fully closed on him, but his luck ran out, and he consoled himself by drinking from his stolen wares while he waited.

title: Texas man, 22, sentenced for murder he committed after removing ankle monitor
description: Jordan Isaiha Lopez, 22, was sentenced to 35 years in prison murdering a 19-year-old during a robbery in 2018 after he took of an ankle monitor he was wearing.

title: Popular Republican governor in key battleground 'leaning' against re-election bid
description: Popular Republican Gov. Chris Sununu, who just passed on a presidential bid, is hinting he may not run for re-election in 2024 in the key battleground state of New Hampshire

title: ICE nabs illegal immigrant convicted for child sex offense, who escaped after parole release in Illinois
description: ICE announced that agents in Illinois had nabbed a Mexican illegal immigrant who had absconded after being placed on parole, having served part of a prison sentence

title: Don Lemon appears to condemn Target for caving to ‘bigoted’ conservatives opposing Pride merchandise
description: During an award show honoring "Black gay excellence," former CNN host Don Lemon ripped corporations for caving to conservative pressure.

title: Biden kicks off first big re-election campaign rally with Philadelphia union workers
description: President Joe Biden picked an enthusiastic, supportive union worker audience for his first 2024 re-election campaign rally in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, on Saturday afternoon.

title: How you can claim part of the $23 million Google privacy settlement
description: After Google agreed to a $23 million settlement for sharing user searches with a third-party, the tech giant stated that it is not because it did wrong.

title: Karine Jean-Pierre claims LGBTQ+ community is ‘literally under attack, literally’ amid Pride month
description: Current White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre spoke out about Pride Month 2023 and said that the gay community is "literally under attack."

title: Kourtney Kardashian, 44, announces she’s pregnant, expecting first child with Travis Barker, 47
description: The eldest Kardashian sister, Kourtney, shared in a social media video that she's expecting her first child with Blink-182 drummer Travis Barker.

title: Video shows terrifying moment Florida deputy is sucked underwater during flood rescue
description: Gripping video shows the moment a Florida sheriff's deputy an a man stranded by floodwaters were sucked into a drainage pipe during a rescue attempt.

title: Military making changes to 'outdated' fitness assessment for troops: report
description: The previous tape test measured the neck, waist and hips, but a study found the test failed to accurately determine body fat by about 35%, prompting an overhaul in the test.

title: ACLU scolded after slamming state for not providing gender affirming care to man executed for rape and murder
description: Conservatives unleashed on the ACLU after the group lamented that Florida not only executed a convicted murderer, but didn't give "gender affirming care."

title: Tori Spelling, Dean McDermott going 'separate ways' after 17-year marriage, 5 kids: report
description: After 17 years of marriage and five children together, Tori Spelling and Dean McDermott are going their "separate ways," McDermott said on social media Saturday.

title: Map buried inside your phone reveals where you’ve been and photos you snapped there
description: Google photos has a hidden map in its app where you will be able to find out when and where a picture was taken, but you can also disable the feature.

title: Details of Trevor Bauer accuser's interview with police surface: report
description: Former Los Angeles Dodgers pitcher Trevor Bauer faced new sexual assault allegations this week. Details about the accuser's interview with police surfaced Saturday.

title: Conor McGregor seen with accuser in club after alleged rape
description: A new video showing UFC star Conor McGregor and the woman who accused him of sexual assault at an NBA game surfaced Saturday in a TMZ Sports report.

title: Michigan 19-year-old planned synagogue mass shooting, FBI claims
description: The FBI said it has arrested a 19-year-old in Michigan after obtaining messages and notes for his alleged plan for a mass shooting at a synagogue.

title: Las Vegas police install cameras on home that reported 'aliens': Family 'afraid for their safety'
description: Las Vegas police said they installed a camera on the home where a family reported seeing "aliens" because they were "scared," police said.

title: Biden says I-95 repair is top priority for government; Dem governor says it can be done within two weeks
description: President Biden visited Philadelphia Saturday and said repairs to Interstate 95 were the most important infrastructure project in the country, pledging the government's full support.

title: Social media galvanized by massive crowd protesting Dodgers honoring drag 'nuns': ‘World is over woke agenda’
description: Social media was full of support for Catholic protestors demonstrating against the L.A. Dodgers honoring an anti-Catholic drag group at a recent Pride event.

title: Fetterman stumbles through remarks with Biden, PA officials while wearing hoodie and shorts
description: Sen. John Fetterman, D-Pa., joined President Biden and Pennsylvania Gov. Josh Shapiro at an event on Saturday in Philadelphia, where he donned a hoodie and a pair of shorts with sneakers.

title: Biden claims spy balloon was 'more embarrassing' for China, suggests it wasn't 'intentional'
description: President Biden on Saturday said that the spy balloon incident was "more embarrassing than it was intentional" for the Chinese, as his top diplomat heads to Beijing.

title: At least 41 killed in Islamic extremist attack on Ugandan secondary school, authorities say
description: At least 41 bodies, including 38 students, were recovered following an attack on a secondary school in Uganda, near the Congo border, authorities said Saturday morning.

title: Pence vows to fire FBI Director Wray, says 'Trump's policy is the same as Joe Biden's'
description: Former Vice President Mike Pence said he will fire FBI Director Christopher Wray and suggested that former President Donald Trump's “policy is the same" as President Biden's.

title: Texas convict murdered family, hid bodies for '5-6 months' in abandoned home: police
description: Robert Morairity is accused of killing his wife and daughter in Texas and hiding their bodies in his abandoned garage for months while he was on the run, according to police

title: Man falls more than 4,000 feet from Grand Canyon skywalk to his death
description: An unidentified man plummeted 4,000 feet from the Grand Canyon Sky Walk platform to his death earlier this week, according to local officials.

title: West Virginia's Bob Huggins arrested on DUI charge
description: West Virginia Mountaineers men's basketball coach Bob Huggins was arrested Friday night on a DUI charge in Pittsburgh, police said.

title: NBA veteran Tony Snell, 31, reveals autism diagnosis
description: Tony Snell, a first-round draft pick of the Chicago Bulls, revealed Friday that he was diagnosed with autism last year and is trying to break the stigma behind it.

title: Indiana AG accusing Biden admin of aiding border 'invasion' as he challenges asylum rule
description: Indiana AG Todd Rokita is accusing the Biden administration of aiding the "invasion" of the U.S. southern border as he leads a legal charge against a new asylum rule.

title: Doctors think gender affirming care for kids is 'crazy,' but are 'too afraid' to speak out: Dr. Marty Makary
description: Dr. Marty Makary weighs in on gender transition surgeries and hormone therapy for minors as several states move to ban the operation for underage kids.

title: Blinken trip to China 'makes no sense' as tensions remain high, trust hits all-time low, expert says
description: State Sec. Blinken intended to visit Beijing months ago, but the appearance of a surveillance balloon believed to have originated in China derailed those plans.

title: North Carolina earthquakes indicative of active fault: report
description: The latest in a series of North Carolina earthquakes struck on Friday, with the magnitude 2.1 tremor shaking the town of West Canton. Geologists reportedly say a fault is now active.

title: MTA bus crashes into Baltimore building, leaves at least 17 injured: report
description: A Baltimore MTA bus crashed into a Central Baltimore building on Saturday morning. Reports state that more than 15 people were injured as a result of the accident.

title: Oscars voters slam Hollywood inclusion standards amid new diversity rules
description: The Oscars are receiving backlash for mandating a new criteria focused on more diverse and inclusive guidelines for "Best Picture" at the Academy Awards.

title: Rocker Dee Snider implores others to join him in standing up to cancel culture mob: ‘You don’t have to cave’
description: In an exclusive interview with Fox News Digital, rock legend Dee Snider talked about his new book "Frats" and how he will not be bullied by the political mob.

title: Northern California county mulls secession as local activist spearheads effort
description: A local activist is proposing for a northern California county to secede and become its own state, arguing for residents to have their way of life respected.

title: Ukraine's Zelenskyy inspired by Polish artist who chronicled freedom and liberty
description: Artist Jan Matejko is a national hero in his native Poland, where his paintings are a symbol of the universal struggle of liberty. His artworks record seminal moments in Polish and world history.

title: Retired auto shop owner brings business to the classroom for 'real world' teaching: ‘Perfection is expected’
description: Industrial tech teacher Rob Van Der Hagen and BOLD High School rising seniors Austin Schroeder and Tate Sheehan detail their 'real-world' shop class.

title: Prime suspect in 1997 New York cold case murder arrested 26 years later
description: A former New York corrections officer, who was considered a suspect in his estranged wife's murder in 1997, was arrested this week after more than two decades.

title: Chiefs' Patrick Mahomes appears to fire back at Bengals' Ja'Marr Chase amid quarterback comments
description: Kansas City Chiefs star Patrick Mahomes appeared to clap back at Cincinnati Bengals wide receiver Ja'Marr Chase over the top QB debate.

title: Sweltering Texas heat wave scorches southern cities, bringing triple-digit temperatures
description: Sweltering heat is expected to bake southern Texas over the weekend, bringing triple-digit temperatures and critical fire weather conditions and a wind advisory in El Paso.

title: Arnold Schwarzenegger convinced he could win the presidency – there's just one problem
description: Former California Gov. Arnold Schwarzenegger says he believes it's a “no-brainer" he could win the presidency in 2024 if he were able to run for election.

title: More than 70 letters containing 'suspicious' white powder sent to Kansas lawmakers, officials, FBI says
description: The FBI and multiple state agencies are investigating after dozens of Kansas lawmakers and officials reported receiving letters containing a suspicious white powder.

title: LeBron James claps back at 'lames' just two days after he was trolled by Nuggets coach Michael Malone
description: Lakers superstar LeBron James did not take kindly to Nuggets head coach Michael Malone's trash. The four-time NBA champion took to social media to clap back at Malone's recent dig.

title: Airline traveler ducks baggage fees by doing this with a fishing vest
description: On "Your World with Neil Cavuto," attorney Julie Waters revealed how she rolls her clothes for a week into a fishing vest — and avoids extra baggage feels by the airlines. She explained.

title: Hundreds missing in migrant boat sinking; EU Commissioner says 'worst ever tragedy' in Mediterranean
description: The EU Commissioner for Home Affairs called the sinking of a migrant boat off the coast of Greece 'the worst ever tragedy we’ve seen' in the Mediterranean.

title: West Nile virus cases, positive samples detected across the country
description: U.S. health officials are reporting cases and positive samples of the West Nile virus, including in an older adult in Iowa. The virus is spread primarily through mosquito bites.

title: Gavin Newsom says he 'aspires' 'to be Ronald Reagan' on this key issue
description: The 40th Governor of California said he wants to emulate the 33rd Governor of California when it comes to gun control policy, alluding to the Mulford Act.

title: Trooping the Colour kicks off King Charles’ official birthday parade as monarch
description: King Charles III marked his first official birthday celebration as monarch with Trooping the Colour. Queen Elizabeth last rode on horseback during the public celebration.

title: This Father's Day, let's all come together to end America's crisis around childbirth deaths
description: World-famous Olympic athlete Tori Bowie died last month from complications from childbirth. It shouldn't have ever happened. America must come together to fight maternal mortality.

title: Snuggly 'velcro dog' is the perfect 'telework companion,' says DC rescue
description: This 2-year-old bulldog-Lab mix is an adoptable pet looking for a new home with active parents who could take him on adventures and expeditions. He's in the Washington, D.C., area.

title: Toronto Blue Jays' Anthony Bass vs. Colin Kaepernick. Guess which athlete is being punished for his views?
description: Our sports media lionized ex-San Francisco 49er's quarterback Colin Kaepernick when he protested police violence. But it has been a whole differenst story for Toronto's Anthony Bass.

title: 'Sexist as hell': See the request that had a woman seeing red as she prepared to meet her boyfriend's family
description: The Fox News Lifestyle Newsletter brings you trending stories on family, travel, food, neighbors helping neighbors, pets, autos, military veterans, heroes, faith and American values.

title: Former real estate professional Amy Siewe joins the fight against the growing python problem in Florida
description: Python huntress Amy Siewe discusses her life tracking down and skinning snakes in Florida after a 13-year career in real estate on "Fox News Saturday Night."

title: Expert argues against federal AI agency despite growing momentum for idea on Capitol Hill
description: People need to change how they're thinking about regulating AI, according to an expert who pushed back on an idea supported by lawmakers to create a new agency to regulate AI.

title: California man arrested on suspicion of starting wildfire that burned over 19K acres
description: California wildfire officials announced Friday that a Mariposa County resident had been identified as the suspect responsible for starting the Oak fire and arrested on felony charges.

title: Levin: If relevant law applied to Trump, 'Bill Clinton would be doing 50 years with his wife'
description: Judge Amy Berman Jackson ruled in favor of President Clinton in a case regarding whether he had discretion in determining which records from his administration were personal.

title: Shocking CDC statistics show the number of US children that received mental health treatment in 2021
description: A data brief released by the CDC on Tuesday indicated that 15% of children and adolescents aged 5-17 received treatment for mental health issues in 2021.

title: Good Samaritan follows suspect in woman's brutal attack until cops arrive
description: The Tulsa County Sheriff's Office is commending a good Samaritan who followed a driver of a car who was allegedly beating a female passenger, which led to the suspect's arrest.

title: Arkansas woman goes viral staging 'silly,' risque photo shoot on roof to raise home repair funds
description: An Arkansas woman, shocked that she needed to pay $10,000 to replace her leaky roof, went viral after posting "silly" and risque selfies of herself on the roof to raise money.

title: African leaders arrive in Russia to discuss peace plan with Putin after Ukraine visit
description: Leaders from seven African countries have arrived in St. Petersburg to meet with Russian President Vladimir Putin following their time in Ukraine.

title: Father's Day didn't become an official holiday until 1972 though the idea developed in the early 1900s
description: Father's Day, the celebration of dads, has a long history before it became an official holiday. Take a look back at the story of the day and how it came to be.

title: Portland resident sounds alarm over city's 'Safe Rest Village' program: Area of 'organized crime and drugs'
description: Portland resident and PDX Real founder Angela Todd shares insight into the city's homeless crisis and the Safe Rest Villages program on 'Jesse Watters Primetime.'

title: Georgia auto shop owner ordered to fork over $39K after paying former employee in oil-covered pennies
description: A court ordered a Georgia auto shop owner to pay more than $39,000 in back wages and damages to nine workers after he paid a former employee in 91,000 oil-covered pennies.

title: University System of Georgia, UGA among institutions hacked by Russian cybercriminals: reports
description: The University System of Georgia and the University of Georgia were hit by the global cyberattack launched by Russian cybercriminals, according to officials,

title: Patriots' Jack Jones arrested on gun charges at Boston airport
description: New England Patriots defensive back Jack Jones was arrested Friday at Logan Airport in Boston after bringing loaded guns to the TSA security checkpoint.

title: Dodgers honor anti-Catholic drag 'nuns' more than an hour before first pitch inside nearly empty stadium
description: Under a barrage of criticism, the Dodgers rescinded an invitation to the Sisters of Perpetual Indulgence, before later reinviting the satirical LGBTQ+ group.

title: On this day in history, June 17, 1885, the Statue of Liberty arrives in New York
description: The Statue of Liberty arrived in New York by ship on this day in history, June 17, 1885. Construction would take some time, as the pedestal was still being built.
